name: 冒險治療研究
description:
An in depth analysis of the theory and practice of adventure therapy including its history, current status, and future direction. Students will be expected to facilitate groups using adventure activities in a therapeutic context.
To expose students to the history and systems of adventure therapy.
To allow students to have practical experience using adventure in a therapeutic context.
goals: 理解戶外技巧、知識與軟性能力與各諮商學派之整合模式
帶領不同個案之個別議題，有轉化處遇之能力
能尊重個案之個別差異，案主自決
堅守治療的保密與諮商倫理
遵守戶外生態無痕山林原則，並能讓不同意議題之個案與案家得到最好之處遇能力
syllabus:
修課學生請務必於2018年3月3日與5月27日參加冒險治療戶外課程，4月20-21參加研討會。

Week 1-3: The Overview and Theory of AT (CH：1-4)

Foundation of AT

The wilderness challenge model

Wilderness as healing place

Therapeutic process of change

Week 4-6: Application of AT(CH：5-10)

Programming Applications of AT

Therapeutic wilderness programming for borderlineadolescents

The use of three-day therapeutic wilderness adjuntby the COBS with survivors of violence

Building family teams：An adventure-based approach to enrichment andintervention

The theoretical foundations for adventure familytherapy

Week 7-10: Programming of AT Experience (CH：11-19)

Programming principles for successfullyimplementing AT

The wilderness as therapy： The value of using adventure programs intherapeutic assessment

Risk management in adventure programs with specialpopulations：Two hidden dangers

A group development model for AT programs

Like father like son：The assessmentand interruption of maladaptive, multigenerational family patterns within atherapeutic wilderness adventure

How to use equipment therapeutically

Experiential challenge program development in themental health setting： A case study

What happens when ropes courses move from thewoods to psychiatric treatment facilities

Week 11-13: Procession of Adventure Experience(CH：20-25)

The evolution of processing AT experiences

How to design a debriefing session

Designing procession questions to meet specificobjectives

Enhancing metaphor development in AT programs

Paradox and double binds in adventure-basededucation

Alternative methodologies for processing

Week 14-16: Research of AT Programs(CH：26-32)

The evaluation and research of AT programs

Emerging for recovery： A descriptive analysis of AT for substanceabusers

Troubled young people after the adventure program：A case study

Project Choices: Adventure-based residential drugtreatment for court-referred youth

Of wilderness and circles: Evaluating atherapeutic model for wilderness adventure programs

Three approaches to evaluation: A ropes courseillustration

Annotated bibliography for the therapeutic uses ofadventure-challenge-outdoor-wilderness：Theory andresearch

Week 17-18: The Future of Adventure (CH：33-39)

The future of the profession of AT

Enhancing career development in adventure programs

Surviving an outdoor adventure group

A staff development model

Wilderness programs offer promising alternativesfor some youth: More regulation likely

Ethical principles for the therapeutic adventureprofessional group

The family wilderness program: A description ofthe project and its ethical concerns

After each section, eachstudent need to present one of the AT articles listed in the above or Disc oncein this semester.
